name: Sidney Jones
title: Senior DevOps Software Engineer
summary: Accomplished technology leader with extensive experience in driving software engineering management, enterprise architecture, and large-scale transformation initiatives.

bullets.text: Reengineered release train processes, cutting delivery timelines by 50% and enabling 13 teams to deploy independently with higher quality.
Amplified month-end closing productivity by 300% through creation of web-based application integrating CRM, LMS, and ERP systems.

ClaimChoice Hub: Architected and delivered cloud-native TPA integration platform that migrated workflows from .NET to Java, streamlined eligibility, payroll, and claims processing, and reduced manual overhead to support client scalability.

bullets.text: Directed **cross-functional teams (web, mobile, API, mainframe)** across multiple delivery trains, implementing **continuous delivery pipelines** that reduced release time by 50%.
Led modernization of Edward Jones’ enterprise *Online Access* platform, **transitioning from legacy monoliths to microservices and micro-frontends** using **Java, Python, and AWS**.
Established **technical delivery governance** — code quality metrics, automation standards, and DevOps maturity assessments across 13 Agile teams — improved reliability and delivery speed.

bullets.text: Developed secure SFTP services, ETL pipelines, and SQL-driven automation to enable seamless integrations with Paylocity and third-party systems. Engineered Voice of Customer (VOC) AI application to analyze sentiment from customer interviews, while deploying AWS CloudWatch dashboards for performance monitoring. Created automated financial workflows using Azure Functions, SQL, and Selenium RPA to synchronize eligibility and payroll data with Paylocity. Integrated LLM technology to automate data access layer generation, enhance code validation, and optimize UI/UX orchestration. Built e-commerce solutions (React, NodeJS, AWS EC2/NoSQL) with Stripe and PayPal integrations, including admin portals for inventory and content management.

Spearheaded **cloud-first modernization initiatives** for financial and healthcare clients, transitioning legacy ERP and reporting systems to **Azure and AWS** platforms — improved reliability and delivery speed.

Designed and implemented **scalable, distributed architectures** using **Python, Node — improved reliability and delivery speed.js, React, and serverless components**, aligning engineering outcomes with business KPIs.

bullets.text: Invented a data-driven orchestration framework for ECM communication on vehicle networks, enabling adaptive protocol handling across J1850-VPW, PWM, J1939, CAN/GM LAN, and ISO standards.
Designed a dynamic diagnostic communication module capable of learning and adapting to new OEM protocols without reengineering core components — improved reliability and delivery speed.

Developed calibration and service applications used by ISUZU, Harley-Davidson, Freightliner, Detroit Diesel, Mac, Eaton, and Penske, improving diagnostic accuracy and time-to-market for new vehicle platforms.

Collaborated with product and QA teams to design automated defect-tracking systems, optimizing regression cycles and standardizing test execution across enterprise environments.

experience.role: Junior Software Developer – Vehicle Communications & Diagnostics

bullets.text: Supported initial automation of test workflows through batch scripting and unit harnesses, reducing manual regression validation time by over 30%.

Contributed to the development of embedded diagnostic software and communication utilities for heavy-duty and automotive OEMs including GM, Freightliner, and Detroit Diesel, forming the basis of what became Nexiq's flagship USB Link diagnostic interface — improved reliability and delivery speed.

Developed C++ modules for ECM/TCM communication supporting multiple transport layers (J1850 VPW, PWM, CAN, ISO 9141, and J1939) used in early vehicle network testing tools — improved reliability and delivery speed.

selected_bullets: Supported initial automation of test workflows through batch scripting and unit harnesses, reducing manual regression validation time by over 30%.

Developed C++ modules for ECM/TCM communication supporting multiple transport layers (J1850 VPW, PWM, CAN, ISO 9141, and J1939) used in early vehicle network testing tools — improved reliability and delivery speed.

experience.role: Software Engineer – Vehicle Diagnostics & Embedded Systems

bullets.text: Developed next-generation diagnostic tools for OEM clients including Harley-Davidson, Isuzu, and Penske, enabling technicians to analyze, calibrate, and service vehicles through dynamic data interfaces.

Engineered data-driven diagnostic frameworks in C and C++ for multiple communication protocols (J1850, J1939, CAN, ISO 9141), ensuring real-time vehicle data acquisition and cross-platform compatibility — improved reliability and delivery speed.

Designed modular ECM communication libraries capable of detecting and adapting to new OEM protocols without re-engineering the core stack — a precursor to today's plugin and microservice architectures — improved reliability and delivery speed.
